    • Description

    You can flaunt your style everywhere you go with the Fastrack Revoltt FR1 Pro smartwatch, which also offers an outstanding experience for users. You can answer and accept calls while you're out and about while also directly calling your favourite contacts with the Revoltt FR1's Advanced SingleSync BT Calling. Discover all your favourite sports on your watch and rule Multiple Sports Modes with auto multisport identification. You can participate in your favourite sports while still staying fit and active. With a 360x360 pixel resolution and a 3.53 cm (1.3) AMOLED display, this wristwatch also enables you to use it in the sweltering sun. You can appreciate its performance in this way wherever you are.

    Read More
    Product Description
    AMOLED Display

    Unveiling the Fastrack Revoltt FR1 Pro, a unique smartwatch with a 3.53 cm (1.3) AMOLED display and 360x360 pixel resolution that allows you to use it even in the blazing sun. In this manner, you can enjoy its performance wherever you go.

    SingleSync Bluetooth Calling

    With the Revoltt FR1's Advanced SingleSync BT Calling, you can answer and accept calls while you're out and about while also dialling your preferred contacts straight from your wrist.

    Multiple Sports Modes

    With auto multisport recognition, uncover all your favourite sports on your watch and dominate Multiple Sports Modes. You can engage in your favourite sports while remaining healthy and active at the same time.

    Split Screen Superiority

    Utilising the Split Screen functionality, you can access your most recent features with only a swipe on your Watch's Home Screen. You can multitask with great ease by just swiping right on the Home Screen.

    Unmatched Battery Life

    You can make use of all the features of this smartwatch without having to worry about running out of power thanks to the long-lasting battery that is built inside it.

    Q:Can I see the WhatsApp notification ???? As it's say only notification specific to call related only .
